##Annual Scientific Production by year


```{r data}



df_year<-paper %>% select(year_published) %>% 
                   group_by(year_published) %>% 
                   summarise(count = n())

df_year

```



```{r barggplot2}
ggplot(df_year, aes(x=year_published, y=count)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity")+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 2002:2018) + ggtitle("Annual Scientific Production by year") + 
  xlab("year") + ylab("Frequency")
  
```


##Most Relevant Sources

```{r}
journal.1<-df_paper%>%select(id_journal)%>%group_by(id_journal)%>%
                      summarise(count=n())%>%arrange(desc(count))%>%
                      head(10)
journal.1


```

```{r}
ggplot(data = journal.1, aes(x = reorder(id_journal,count), y = count)) + 
         geom_bar(stat = "identity") + 
         theme(axis.text = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))+
         ggtitle("Top 10 Sources") + xlab("Sources") + ylab("# articles pusblished")
```
